about_the_game:
"Alright, here’s the situation. We’ve got a bit of a mess in the storage. NaN’s prototype particles—codename 'hora'—escaped through the vents. Now they’re clinging to everything, reacting to lights and electronics. Your job? Go in, clean up the contaminated stuff, shut the vents for extra credits, and restart the generator to override the sectors' system access. Once the generator is online, extract and return to the lobby. Sounds simple, but it’s not.

Regular staff already went in. We haven’t heard from them since. So now it’s up to you, NaN’s best-trained team. We’ve equipped you with specialized tech that won’t trigger hora—mostly. Your lights and comms are modded to avoid trouble. Oh, and there’s a purple light. Don’t ask why it’s purple—it works, and that’s what matters. Just remember, it’s weak and burns through energy like nothing else.

One more thing: you’ll need a team. Four players are ideal. Go in with less, and… well, let’s just say the odds aren’t great."

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Prepare in the Lobby: Use the console to order tools like batteries and upgrades. Plan your approach carefully—resources are limited, and every decision matters.

  • Enter a Sector: Find the generator to override the system access. You’ll need it to get out alive.

  • Loot Contaminated Items: Shut vents and collect contaminated objects to gather hora and earn credits which you can use for upgrades and accessing new sectors.

  • Manage Your Resources:

    • Energy: Your tactical lights drain batteries fast. Use them wisely.

    • Stamina: Physical strain and high BPM (heart rate) will get you exhausted fast.

    • Teamwork: Stick together and share responsibilities—going solo won’t end well.

  • Extract and Repeat: Return to the elevator, dump your loot, and go back in—if you can handle it.

  • Don’t Let hora Take Over: If the system integrity is breached, you’re done. Trust me, you don’t want to see what happens then.

Key Features

  • Co-Op (Max 4 Players): Work as a team to survive the storage and clean up the mess.

  • Procedurally Generated Levels: Every sector is unique, with new layouts and challenges each time.

  • Progression and Strategy: Earn credits by looting, then spend it on tools, upgrades and unlocking new sectors.

  • Twitch Integration: Stream viewers can help—or sabotage—you by influencing your game through connected accounts.

  • Resource Management: Balance energy and heart rate while navigating dangerous zones.

  • Unique Enemy Designs: Encounter foes with distinct behaviors. Play along with "Her" games.

  • Rising Tension: Each cleared area ramps up the stakes with tougher challenges and more complex environments.

"That’s it. You know the mission. Now grab your gear, team, and let’s hope you make it back in one piece."

name: hora

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core I5 7th Generation
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce RTX 1060
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Currently there are several claims that the 13th and 14th gen of Intel CPUs have issue with games made in Unreal Engine.
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 11
  • Processor: AMD CPU
  • Memory: 16 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GeForce RTX 4060
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 5 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Currently there are several claims that the 13th and 14th gen of Intel CPUs have issue with games made in Unreal Engine.

short_description: A co-op extraction game where you—{SYSTEM ERROR: UNDEFINED OBJECTIVE}—"Uh, hey, Paul here. Forget the formalities. Grab the contaminated stuff, override the systems access, and get out alive. Keep your lights low and stick together. Now stop reading and get to work!"
